quote: Nelmy brings expertise, organization and positivity to any team meeting she's part of. Her sincere demeanor, her focus, drive and optimism are what make her a great leader and the best candidate for this award.
Nelmy is a great part of this place, working hard, fostering teamwork, helping Advancement continue to grow, learn and keep moving forward.

Nelmy is a shining star who makes every project she touches shine brighter than would ever have been possible without her stellar contributions. She has been a pioneer in helping University Advancement move forward with digital analytics in an innovative and strategic manner.
Nelmy is a positive innovator who brings clarity in the midst of chaos.

Nelmy's default setting is to go above and beyond. What a gift she is giving us all by creating the Email Benchmark Dashboard, which will help us clearly see and effectively address what's working and what's not in our email communications.

Nelmy's work with the Analytics Dashboard project is quintessential to bringing disparate units across the University together through data visualization and comparison. Her heartfelt kindness has impacted me since day one at University Advancement; she's the best workplace ally I could ask for.

Nelmy has worked Above & Beyond to create a Marketo Analytics Dashboard to that will Impact units across campus by providing the ability to compare digital engagement and learn from each other's success. This embodies 3.0 Framework by being forward thinking and UA/UW values by promoting Innovation and Collaboration while doing our best work together!

Nelmy is more than just a star, she is a shining example of the very type of colleague we should all be to one another.  She is the very epitome of our Advancement values and portrays them and holds them strong in all that she does.
Nelmy somehow magically turns messy, incomplete data into smart and thoughtful insights to inform our work and make it better. She is amazing!
Nelmy brings a mastery of data to her work and an uplifting attitude to all of her interactions with colleagues. She brightens any project team and makes us all better.
In a constellation of STARS, Nelmy's light is one of the brightest of the bunch. She is an inspiring and thoughtful colleague deserving of this recognition.
Nelmy is hard-working, helpful, and innovative.  She is always willing to help and everything she does is to help make Advancement better.
Nelmy is a fantastic colleague to partner with because of her positive attitude, strategic approach, and incredible commitment to doing things the right way.

Nelmy is a great leader and team player, she always makes the time to help us either understand digital analytics better or use the technology appropriately so that we can advance our mission, support our students, and connect with our donors.
Erin is a superstar and deserves to be recognized for her enormous impact, her embodiment of UA and UW values and her impact in pushing her program forward!
Erin is one of the most thoughtful and collaborative members on the team! She is always willing to help her fellow colleagues and go above and beyond to get the job done.

Erin is a wicked smart ray of sunshine who always brings her best to the team and inspires the best from the team. UW Medicine Advancement is so incredibly lucky to have such a warm, talented, driven staff member.
Erin's can-do attitude, diversity of skills, and high-levels of organization and creativity make her an indispensable member of the UW Medicine Advancement team!
Erin inspires me to push harder every day. I am so grateful for her!

Erin Sontag is a powerhouse in the UWM Donor Relations team, bringing her formidable design and editorial talents to raise the specter of stewardship impact reports for the Institute for Protein Design.  Her drive for excellence and innovation have been critical in stewarding the IPD's most generous leadership donors.

While Erin's primary role is on the Donor Relations team, she is extremely knowledgeable and over-the-top helpful on all of Advancement operations and procedures, and is a great sounding board for strategies. True to her home department and core responsibilities--Erin's constant lens is focused on our donors, and how we might deepen--authentically--our relationship with them.
Erin is a powerhouse! She is so knowledgeable and thoughtful. We are so lucky to have her on the team.
Erin is responsive, easy going, and deals well with challenging situations and people.

Jill's outstanding collaboration with faculty, CFR, and individual giving, combined with her drive, passion for student success, and positive outlook, has led to the success of the Industry Capstone Program. The relationships she has built with industry partners have resulted in stronger relationships for the College of Engineering as a whole.
Jill is innovative, thoughtful, and a true collaborator -- working seamlessly with staff, faculty and industry partners, all for the good of students and their engineering education.

Jill is a dedicated member of our UW advancement community and her quiet but highly effective leadership skills have created deep impact in the College of Engineering. Jill is wholly focused on both her personal mission to build a world-class industry capstone program, and also her role as a supportive colleague as she is a true force of positivity, integrity and kindness on our team.

Jill has had enormous impact for students and industry sponsors, while serving as an amazing team player.  She goes the extra ten miles never fails to promote a positive, professional (and fun) persona.  She's earned a STAR award!
Jill is driven, smart, and positive. Her ability to make connections and elevate the student experience through her daily work inspires us all.

Jill works to both express and take action on the goals and value of the industry capstone programs (on behalf of students) and also understand and integrate this with the individual needs of departments across Engineering. Her ability to manage the complexity of all stakeholder needs, putting students first, has made  the CoE Industry Capstone program an incredible success, and led to continued growth.

In the last three years Jill transitioned into an entirely new role and started the College of Engineering's Industry Capstone Program from scratch, building it into a model program that  is the envy for many campus units. Throughout the program's journey Jill has delivered strong execution, effective collaboration with academic partners and industry contacts and delivered a program that enriches engineering education while responding to regional industry needs.

Jill Kaatz is a rockstar team member who carries out her work with tremendous positivity, diligence, and heart. She is a valued collaborator who is lays a strong foundation within CFR that helps students, faculty, and companies alike to create lasting impact within engineering and beyond.
Chris is a selfless leader and strategic thinker with a constant eye toward collaboration and genuine concern for his team and the department.

Chris has become a respected leader at UW Medicine, and has greatly increased the impact and influence of our CFR team. He has done this with great humility and thoughtfulness, ensuring that all partners and teammates feel valued and empowered.

During times of great uncertainty, it's comforting to know that our values don't change and we have colleagues like Chris who continue their excellent work collaboratively and with respect for everyone's unique circumstances.

Chris Thompson is an exemplary team player. Recently he has served as a leader on our COVID-19 efforts, helping draft the central case statement and ensuring our messaging was aligned and compelling. He is selfless, thoughtful and kind and always puts others first.

Chris epitomizes the phrase "going above and beyond," and this could not have been more evident than during our recent response to the COVID-19 crisis.  The sustained pace of fundraising for our UW Medicine Response Fund was unlike anything any of us has seen previously in our professional careers.  And at the center of much of this activity was Chris.  His ability to very swiftly translate complex scientific concepts into layperson terms, was central to our ability to quickly stand up a very effective fundraising effort and churn out excellent, compelling proposals for our top philanthropists in our community.  He is the type of high performer who works around the clock to get the important work done on time, and then asks what else he can do to help.

Chris Thompson is a leader and a role model at Team Medicine.  Chris cares for his team, gives away credit, builds trusting relationships with his faculty and consistently goes above and beyond in everything he does for our team.
Chris is a humane leader with a million and one responsibilities at work.
Chris Thompson has been working tirelessly to secure large foundation grants for COVID-19 research and care.
One person does a good job is great, but a team does a good job is outstanding.  Adam is help F&A to achieve outstanding goals.

Adam exemplifies all the values of UA culture and does so with humility and grace. He tackles ever project with gusto, even if its not normally in his job, and always brings the very best ideas and questions for how to make things better.
Adam has gone above and beyond his everyday job duties and he deserves some gold stars.
Adam deserves praise for tirelessly supporting all who need his help. He is the exemplary team player. I feel very fortunate to be his colleague. He does it all with grace and humility.
Adam is always willing to help out fellow colleagues and his dedication to Advancement is unparalleled.
Adam's high standards and concern for his colleagues makes him an invaluable member of Advancement.
Adam is an amazing collaborator and a true partner. He works through many different situations that are often last minute and complicated with complete grace and positivity.
Gloria provides tremendous leadership and foresight in managing the Annual Giving program and her beat areas.

Gloria is the definition of a collaborator. She always finds a way to get to "yes"- helping raise lots of money, keep faculty as engaged philanthropy partners, and provide personal outreach to our constituents.

I feel we often can't help to recognize those with the loudest voices but Gloria deserves to be recognized for her humble yet powerful leadership. My experience as part of the University of Washington community would not be the same if it weren't for Gloria Chien and I know many of our colleagues and donors feel the same.

Gloria masters the perfect combination of professional and personable, developing meaningful relationships across our organization which are invaluable to the success of UW Medicine. Gloria is not always the loudest voice in the room but often the most thoughtful.

While it has always been readily apparent that Gloria Chien is a consummate professional, my experiences in working alongside her has demonstrated her dedication to excellence, collaboration, and integrity. She is unendingly kind and patient with faculty and donors alike, and constantly seeks to find solutions for them.
Gloria is the true embodiment of UW Advancement values, approaching her work every day with positivity and service to her colleagues. We are lucky to have her.

Wendelin is a joyful endeavoring spirit who patiently works to ensure that no detail is overlooked and that the people she supports feel heard. Her curious and persistent work has led to shifts in how we do our work that make us both more efficient and better prepared to serve our community.
Wendelin's pursue for excellence is inspiring, she not only produces high quality digital communications but she also continuously motivates others to follow best practices.
Wendelin is so sunny and fun and hardworking!

In a short period of time, Cara has lead a new small team with limited resources to successfully serve multiple units, something that would not have been possible if it wasn't for the strong partnerships she has built and the trust that she inspires. She is a great example that 'our best work is done together'.
Cara leads from a place of understanding and it shows on all of her work. I feel comfortable sharing my ideas and in time of crisis sharing my concerns. That's a big deal!

Cara is leading her team to be successful by developing a more insightful data-driven approach to the Annual Philanthropy team and leading efforts in developing effective analytical tools that will inform the way we work now and well into the future.
Kris brings his skill and expertise to work as he resolves technology and equipment issues without fuss.  Moreover he does so readily, and with great kindness.
They are consistency and dependability at a time of great inconsistency and unknown. Their calm support continues to be a rock for central Advancement.

Kris has been innovative and flexible in getting our team set up with computers to effectively work from home, solving every hurdle we put in his way! He also developed a whole new philosophy on buying and replacing computers that's going to hugely improve our ability to get people the equipment they need to do their jobs.

She has worked Above & Beyond to survey users across campus, hear their voice and then communicate those needs to Central so we all can receive the proper training during this new normal. It embodies 3.0 Framework by being forward thinking and UA/UW values by promoting Innovation and Collaboration while doing our best work together!
Elly is invaluable to the work we do not just in Information Management, but the University as a whole

Elly works tirelessly to increase her knowledge on our current products and the products we could be using simply to make our user's experience better. I feel confident that Elly Henriksen is so very deserving of this award and hope you will too.
Kate is the perfect combination of professional and fun. Working with is ALWAYS a pleasure and pushes me to be better. I am a better person for knowing Kate.
Kate Mortensen joined the College of Arts & Sciences team and immediately influenced how we work as a cohesive, high-achieving team. She has a can-do attitude that bowls you over with enthusiasm.
Kate embodies grace under pressure!

The impact of Julie Ngo's work will be felt in UA for decades. Her fingerprints are on every project, her enthusiasm keeps the team going in even the most frustrating moments and we would arguably be lost without her.
We would be lost without Julie.
Julie is the powerhouse that's making the whole CRM migration tick.

Though James has been with our team for a short time, his knowledge of university systems is incredible and he's always looking for ways to leverage the impact of Environment programming through cross-campus Advancement partnerships. He is a wonderful asset to our team and we cannot wait to see what he accomplishes in his new role!

Although James has only been with our team a short time, he's always eager to roll up his sleeves and dive into something new. His knowledge of university systems is incredible and he's always looking for ways to leverage the impact of Environment programming through cross-campus Advancement partnerships. He is a wonderful asset to our team and we cannot wait to see what he accomplishes in his new role!

Dana Arviso calmly, efficiently, industriously, impactfully and collaboratively envisions, secures funding for, and implements the College of Education's United:Ed initiative, which aligns innovative research with community needs and ensures that diverse community partners and doctoral students benefit equitably and soon from that research.
See earlier nomination (Part 1) Thank you!
Lindsay is so nice and smart!

Lindsay goes way above and beyond every day to put the needs of others before her own, accomplishes all her goals on time, while moving our strategic vision forward, and meeting questions and challenges with wisdom. She leads by example, celebrating the accomplishments of others, and puts forward our team's strengths. Lindsay's own strengths embrace the smallest detail and the broadest vision, while inviting everyone else along with her.
Laura is a learner who really unites her colleagues! Her work shows that our best work is done together.
If you need to get things done right and throughly...COUNT ON LAURA!

Krista's leadership of the DEI book group has introduced an important outlet for personal and professional growth, and her consistency in making it happen is a welcome chance each quarter to add some meaningful socializing to my week.
Krista finds myriad ways to be involved and inspire internal and external partners.

As the University has been coordinating its response to the COVID-19 crisis, Isaiah Brookshire has gone above and beyond. He asked how he could help, and has been sharing his time with our UMAC colleague to help relieve some of the overwhelming communications pressure.

Isaiah Brookshire goes "above and beyond" to cordially and efficiently provide communications magic to both Regional Advancement and UWAA. Just when you think you are aware of everything Isaiah has to offer, another facet of his talent is revealed.
Jenny and T are an unstoppable force for the School of Nursing. The term "other duties as assigned" was never more relevant to a team than what they accomplished this year.
Tiffany is a great relationship builder, making her a dependable friend and excellent colleague to many. She is the epitome of "our best work is done together"!
They are consistency and dependability at a time of great inconsistency and unknown. Their calm support continues to be a rock for central Advancement.
A kind helping hand, in an uncertain time.

Jill has built an Advancement Services team that serves the needs of our College, our fundraising team, and the UA mission. This team works hard to serve internal partners, while honoring our donors and the impact they make.
Jill is the perfect girl boss!

Kevin Dugan combines internal and external relationship-building to create a powerful, yet understated presence on UW Tacoma's integrated Advancement Team, fueling his ability to consistently secure significant resources, and build sustainable, perpetual institutional connections. Kevin upholds the highest standards in forging both immediate and lasting impacts benefiting UW Tacoma and the Milgard School of Business.
Kevin is a proud South Sound Husky and a walking UW Tacoma alumni success story.  His humility, insistence on sharing successes and fearlessness of failure are inspiring.
An undaunted leader who sees the best in all whom she meets, Claire embodies the culture of excellence created at UA. In all teams she leads and joins, Claire lifts everyone up to do their best work.

In addition to bringing an exemplary level of dedication and excellence to her work as a leader, Claire exudes warmth, humor and humanity ' something that transcends the day-to-day obligations of the workplace.

Rebecca performed two jobs - the editorial assistant position and digital content producer position - which was especially demanding when UW News was on the front lines of the UW's response to the coronavirus epidemic. She is increasing the reach of UW News, and she is a supportive and uniting force.

Rebecca has reshaped the way we organize our work, the technology we use to deploy it, and the platforms we use to tell our stories. She is a great cross-team collaborator who has gained a reputation for excellent work with sensitivity to the diversity of our UW News audience within and outside the university community.

Callie's communication skills make even the driest project burst with energy and fun. She is a sorceress with words and her commitment to the voice of the constituent ensure we always have their needs top of mind.

I understand this award should go to someone that goes above and beyond, demonstrates our values, and has a positive impact in our community. Without any hesitation and with much pride I cannot think of another person that embodies these criteria more than Callie Hamilton.

Alex goes way above and beyond and when she was doing two jobs for a while before making her transition to CBE, she still performed to a very high standard and was incredibly collegial, proactive, and donor-focused.

Alex is the kind of leader that both inspires the people she works with to do the big, hard thing, and encourages all of us to be kind and compassionate to ourselves. It's a rare leader that can make an entire unit feel good consistently about the work we are doing, and she's nearly single-handedly done that by positioning us to only expand and improve,
Megan cares deeply for our work, but not as much as she cares for helping people. She's a convener of ideas, colleagues and impact that makes all around her better.
Megan looks for ways to lift others up. She connects personally and is always willing to spend time sharing context in order for someone to do the best work possible.
Melissa is caring and dedicated - we are so lucky to have her!

When Melissa stepped in to help our ASA team - we heaved a collective sigh of relief! Her skills, knowledge of the UW and trustworthy and engaging approach to our work had an immediate impact on our performance and well being.
Mike is very smart and has high standard of his work.
Mike is the ultimate team player - generous in sharing his own knowledge, and eager to learn from his colleagues!

The UW's role in the lives of so many extended families is crucial. We care for students on many of their first journeys away from home. Jannah's work to communicate and care for the families left behind makes such a difference in their health and safety-- extending the Husky family to so many in the state, nation and the world. Thank you Jannah!
Jannah Maresh helps all of us build a welcoming Husky community for parents and families -our #1 partners in student success, retention and securing a top notch incoming class.
Joey brings positivity, intention, and diligence to the workplace. She makes our office a better place to work!

Joey is an integral part of Regional Advancement's development work. Her positive attitude, strong organizational skills, and problem solving abilities keep our team running smoothly. She is such a terrific colleague!
Heather is a bright star among the many at UW Advancement. In partnering with her at my unit, Heather's reach has let me exceed my grasp.
Together Heather Page and Amy Scott's boundless work helps make Planned Giving a "power" team at the UW.
I'm not sure what you're seeking for a 'Power Quote' so included all text above.

Erin knocked out a deep dive in auditing our fiscal budgets with a level of precision and detail not previously achieved, creating a stable foundation to make clear strategic budgetary decisions going forward. Her sunny and sassy disposition has sparked life into the morale of the College of the Environment Advancement team, creating a joyful place for all of us to work.  She is a shining star to guide us forward in these uncertain times.
Together Heather Page and Amy Scott's boundless work helps make Planned Giving a "power" team at the UW.
During a time of duress, Gift Services has made it possible for donors to keep on giving and for University units to benefit from philanthropy.

Melinda represents the best of UA Values - she is an incredible team leader and exemplifies that our best work is done together. With her leadership our College of the Environment Advancement team will come out of this stronger than ever.

Melinda's consistent and transparent leadership has been essential in these difficult times, and she is a star that I plot my course to. She always emphasizes that our best work is done together and encourages us to think about our impact in everything we do.

Kelsea Shannon is an indispensable member of our SPH team whose grace, intelligence and generosity helps us produce our best work with an eye towards innovation, a spirit of giving and a relentless drive for quality.

Kelsea is central to all of our team's efforts and she elevates our delivery quality. I value the way I can totally trust her to catch loose ends or important details and the way she's always willing to critically think through and recommend next steps.
Lynn has been the point person for Stewardship and Donor Relations for a long time, and her leadership and great ideas, as well as collaboration, make everyone's jobs smoother, easier, and better.
Lynn answers questions and solves problems no one else can (literally). She is a superstar!
United with positive attitude, we can achieve greatness in Advancement 3.0!
The finance and administration team members, my colleagues, take UW's and UA's values to heart. Ours is a highly productive and innovative team. They are also fun to work with.

Bravo UWM team! Unbelievable how the whole team rallied under the COVID-19 pandemic, each taking on responsibilities that in some cases had nothing to do with their job descriptions to ensure that the front lines were taken care of. Way to go.

nominee: The UW Medicine Team (Jennifer H., Kristine J., Ben M., Natalie R.)
quote: I have no doubt that the work that Jen, Kristine, Ben, and Natalie did saved lives and continue to do so to this day. I am grateful to live in a world where they make a difference. I am proud to say I am their colleague.
Work with a cheerful attitude is a cherry on the top of ice cream or sunshine in a rainy season!
Melissa is the definition of smart, hardworking, and kind. She is one of the glue people who drives Advancement forward in so many ways.
Jenny and T are an unstoppable force for the School of Nursing. The term "other duties as assigned" was never more relevant to a team than what SON Advancement accomplished this year.
Jenny is hardworking, dedicated, driven, caring, grace under pressure, and highly collaborative. She is an absolute star!

Matt excels in supporting KUOW's mission and vision and lives out our values at all times. He is a enjoyable collaborator, thoughtful leader and has (sometimes) exhausting attention to detail. He puts donors first and advocates on their behalf. He is curious and has courage to take on issues at all levels of the organization. He acts in service to KUOW and the University of Washington and proudly exudes his love for both at the many community events he attends. He's great, go Matt!
Beth created the new Development Leadership Dashboard that helps CAOs keep their finger on the pulse of their unit's progress toward fundraising goals.

From the Office of the President, to all schools and colleges and campuses, from administrative counterparts to faculty and deans, Leslie has brought her expertise, knowledge and practical solutions to our sometimes complicated world. Leslie has been an important UA STAR for 20 years of dedicated commitment.

Rachel continues to impress us with her ability to develop deep and meaningful relationships with donors, her quality stewardship, time management, and fundraising skillset. The relationships she has built with her donors and our team are everlasting, and the UA team and university are better off for it.

The team embraces integrated advancement at the highest levels. They are engage with future Huskies from admissions to acceptance, they communicate with students throughout their UW journey and then provide compelling content for alumni.

The UW has been everywhere in the national news during this crisis, showing that we are leaders. The conduit to make this strategic and successful lies in the work of Victor Balta and the news team. I am so proud to be part of UW right now, and recognize that Victor helped make that even more apparent!

Kristin is such a great partner -- she thinks creatively and outside the box in order to accomplish big ideas. She is willing to go the extra mile to get something done and when she does--it is thorough! And she is always so positive and fun to work with. I leave meetings with her smiling! I'm so grateful to have her as a colleague.

John approaches every assignment with an infectious enthusiasm that inspires those around him. Every story gets the loving care and attention it deserves. Through his work, UW Law is truly able to articulate those qualities that makes our school and university unique.

As the mastermind behind the MBA Rankings Calculator, Andrea has produced data driven expert analysis of several key rankings to strategically develop, align and amplify key Foster messages while managing the evolving expectations of program directors, who are trying to keep enrollment on track amid global uncertainty. In her spare time, Andrea organizes informal team-building activities like the running group, bike outings, and rallies a Foster presence for Whole U challenges and sessions. She's clearly a wonderful steward of Foster and the Foster community, and we are a better team because of Andrea - a dedicated worker and a great connector who excels at rallying people together no matter the cause.
Danna has reinvigorated our CFR program and will be making many dynamic contributions. The groundwork she is laying with donors now will have lasting impact in the years to come.

Eryn is the epitome of University Advancement's values. She is a terrific colleague who takes initiative to get the job done, prioritizes collaboration with all, and is a trusted liaison for many donors whose philanthropy is creating significant impact within our university community.
Julie Brown's leadership is louder than a packed basketball game!

Clint is the trusted, strategic leader that you wait your whole entire career to be able to work for. He'll empower you to use your strengths and instincts to find and maintain success, while helping you grow as a leader.
Amanda's innovation expanded a signature UWAA program, while creating new student leadership opportunities along the way.
Evan paves the way for our team to be successful in the work we do!

Barron is a diligent and thoughtful leader who brings great insight to any project he touches. He spends the time to dig deep into his projects, understanding the complexities of the questions at hand and developing new ways of tracking all aspects of University Advancement's work'from engagement to fundraising to forecasting revenue.
Allison is a powerhouse in preparing analysis for our team to communicate to fundraisers, helping them focus on just the right prospect actions.

She has worked Above & Beyond to survey users across campus, hear their voice and then communicate those needs to Central so we all can enjoy an improved implementation. This has a very broad-reaching impact since it could impact over 300 employees. It embodies 3.0 Framework by being forward thinking and UA/UW values by promoting Innovation and Collaboration while doing our best work together!

Karen Chilcote is a marketing and communications rock star with a creative and strategic mind that brings both opportunities and successful outcomes to all involved. Her deep experience and skillset coupled with a sharp wit makes her Herculean work looks easy.
Lorna brings grace under pressure to the Gift Services team.

unit: Evan's School of Public Policy & Governance
quote: Katie's collaborative approach, inherent drive, sharp instincts, and passion for the mission of the Evans School elevates our day-to-day experience as employees of this great school -- and will pay dividends over time, of that I'm sure. I admire her focus on strategy, on impact, and the way she encourages those around her to always take risks for the sake of something good.

Greg is a natural leader who inspires those around him with his incredible integrity and humility. He is highly committed to the values of the UW, Advancement, and creating great impact through his work in philanthropy.
Audra defines what it means to be an authentic collaborator and champion of unit programming. She makes everyone she comes into contact better!
Good things become great when you focus on the details and Katherine never misses a step.

A highly collaborative and hard working employee who has taken the inaugural role of PaC's System Administrator, and created magic. Grace DeMun is  the bees knees and I'm over the moon to nominate someone so special.
Yvonne is committed to doing the job right!
Miranda has the drive and passion to do what is right and create meaningful impact.
With Pamela, the smallest details matter when it comes to helping others. And often it is those small things that make the biggest impact on people.
Cathy is the heartbeat of our team and takes on projects that need to get done, no matter if they are hers to get done or not!

Lindsay is a powerhouse researcher for UW Medicine who has gone above and beyond during this pandemic. She's an integral part of the PD team and we would be lost without her (as would UW Medicine, I suspect).

Liz artfully took on the huge challenge of planning and stewarding one of our largest international foundation donors, only to have to pivot at the last moment due to having to change and delay plans due to the pandemic. As we move forward to navigate in uncharted CFR waters, Liz is the kind of leader who can keep our faculty focused on their work, on the best moves for cultivating relations with new and existing funders, and to be strategic for where we need to focus next -- a star to guide us all.

I constantly wish we had more than one Meghan not because she can not handle the load but she is a wizard with all that she is tasked with and I can only imagine how effective we would be as a team if we had twice that power.
A tenured member of the UWAA marketing and communications team, Greg is a trusted team player who brings his natural curiosity, attention to grammar and desire to help to the job everyday.
Smart, curious, generous and kind. There is no better example of someone who truly represents everything that UW Advancement strives to be than Emily Fondaw.

I feel safer and more supported with Jess Foss on the job. A true collaborator, she responds quickly to requests with grace, creativity, and an amazing capacity to improvise. But she also proactively anticipates and solves problems in the spirit of "It Starts with Me."
Zoe is a joy to work with, she is kind, patient, organized and hard-working! She is the first to step up to take on a new project and brings her positivity and can-do attitude to work everyday.

Jaime has been an invaluable member of UMAC since she started, keeping track of dozens of projects while moving them along simultaneously. Her spirit of collaboration and willingness to get into the weeds to sort out the tangled web of projects has made our remote work both possible and run smoother than anticipated.
Her commitment to the mission of the university and our college is unwavering, no matter the circumstance.
Amy is an incredible positive influence, especially in these uncertain times. All of us can count on her for the help we need!
Jodie is a rock star and a master at what she does and always with a great attitude.
Creativity, innovation, collaboration and respect are all actions that Jane brings to her work every day.
Lauren is our secret weapon when working with faculty on large foundation grants and her behind the scenes tracking and questioning increases the amount of trust our faculty have in advancement.

Dave Iyall creates a warm and supportive atmosphere where our fundraisers and staff thrive and grow. He approaches cultivating our team in the same way he approaches donor cultivation, with intentional care and integrity. He is invested in the success of each person within our unit, the UA team, and university as a whole.

Brian is a fierce advocate for his team and the impact work that they do. His vision has allowed the TLT team to grow themselves both professionally and personally, setting them up for success in all that they do.
UWAA's Marketing Efforts rely on the excellence and collaborative spirit of Caitlin Klask.

Ed Kromer is a detective, a journalist, a master storyteller, a savvy blogger, and skilled creative director who discovers and crafts compelling stories that move and engage alumni and stakeholders of the Foster School of Business. His stories build a sense of pride and connectedness at every level, from students, staff, and faculty, to alumni, supporters, influencers and the community at large.
As we work toward Advancement 3.0 and true integrated efforts where the whole is so much more than the sum of the parts, we have a wonderful, living, breathing, leading model in Andrew Krueger.

Monet's desire to contribute meaningfully to team conversations, roundtable discussions, and school initiatives reminds me of how much she sees our work not just as a paycheck but as a way to impact communities.
Every team needs a great admin even in the best of times, but this is not the best of times. So we are extra lucky to have Lora.
Eric is a true leader and mentor; always guiding with integrity, collaboration and excellence.

Everyone has a plan until you get punched in the gut.  At that point you are thankful that you have Elizabeth's solutions first, what's best for the university, witty partnership to get you back on your feet.
Johnathan is a thoughtful professional who has faced all the challenges thrown at him this year with positivity, creativity, and a ton of hard work. Bravo!

Jen is an innovator, leader, and inspiration to her team and her peers. She is paving the way for the AP team to be a national model of success and transforming the way way we engage our donors for more meaningful outcomes that will advance the university in numerous ways.
Sarah is one of the most trusted and respected members of the Information Management team.
Whether it be visualizations, Italian, spreadsheets or project kickoffs; Chiara is fluent in all the languages she needs to make Advancement great.
Our University and our community are better informed - and we are better able to hear and meet their needs - thanks to the work of Meg Matthews.
Priscilla is chalk-full of creative ideas that help bring teams together!

Priscilla puts the "fun" in fundraising as a strong collaborative partner and resource for her Advancement peers and students. Her efforts are an essential part of the overall success of increasing our impact.
Nichole is an exemplary employee whose day-to-day work continues to meet and usually exceeds the STAR award criteria.

Den is always the first person in every conversation to encourage the rest of us to think of the user, to adhere to best practices and to work collaboratively so that the communications that live on our website represent the very best of UW Law.
I do not know anyone more universally admired and adored! This is a direct reflection of who Becky is as a person, including but not limited to her hard work, kindness, and willingness to help.
Alethia brings an unmatched energy and glow to her work in UA. Both with her colleagues and donors she is constantly preaching the impact of UA across UW, Seattle and the state of WA.
The thought of Korrie leaving our team is absolutely petrifying. I want her to know that we would be lost without her and need her around for a long time!

Andrew did a superb job of balancing his managerial responsibilities for the west coast regional team and his interim role as CAO for Nursing. He demonstrates integrity in his leadership and he empowers his teams through trust and openness. He is a huge asset to UW and all who work alongside him.
Christina Moon is a go-to, can-do powerhouse.
Emily is thoughtful, hard-working, innovative and creative! She bringing laughter, flexibility and a strong work ethic to every project she touches and never shies away from a challenge.
I love getting to work with Kelsey every day, and her hard-working attitude allows TLT to reach so many more people and do so many more cool projects

Greg approaches every assignment with kindness, compassion and an exacting drive to fully bring UW Law stories and work to life. Thanks to Greg's dedication, UW Law is able to create relatable, engaging content that demonstrates the life-changing efforts by faculty, staff, alumni, donors and other members of our community.
Thu Thu always strives to go above and beyond to help our alumni and friends who contact the UWAA. She is a great asset to the Advancement team!
Allison has an innovative and collaborative spirit, and is a joy to work with!

"Being Julie" is the answer to the question "what superpower do you wish you had?" Whether it's being the shinning light in the office or rocking event management out in the field, she's the superhero UWAA needs right now!
'Nothing so conclusively proves a man's ability to lead others, as what he does from day to day to lead himself.' ~ Thomas J. Watson

When a challenge emerges, Kathleen is always quick to jump-in and volunteer with hard work and solutions, and she's never afraid to get her hands dirty. She quickly adapts to shifting priorities with new ways of thinking and creates endless opportunities to further her relationship with EarthLab donors.
Mike bleeds purple and gold and his commitment to the success and continuity of UW and UA is unparalleled.
Natalie got the COVID-19 hotline up and running fast!

Helen is a terrific ambassador for the University of Washington and Regional Advancement. She is a bright, diligent, thoughtful, and motivated colleague. She is a leader on the Regional Advancement team and her insights are a tremendous asset.
Jacob's can-do attitude and timely help are true reflection of Advancement 3.0.
Even though Kate's appointment is short-term, her ability to jump into new projects has helped her to create a lasting impact on the UW Alumni Tours program.

Ken Shafer's ability to create a terrific summer issue of UW Magazine under our stressful, work-from-home conditions, and accommodate the tremendous amount of content that changed up to the last minute, is a testament to his creativity, innovative thinking -- and his passion for the University. The impact of his work was just as powerful as when he produced the magazine under normal circumstances. Amazing.
Joseph has been a superb mentor and leader to many at Foster School and all of UW.
Every win, success, or advancement activity over the past year has been touched by Danielle's spirit, her kindness, and her undaunted work ethic!

Staishy Bostick Siem is an exemplary mentor who serves multiple leadership roles with distinction, fosters an inclusive culture of communication among her team and internal clients, and tackles challenges with a thoughtful, sensitive and effective approach. Simply put, you cannot spell 'The University of Washington School of Law Marketing and Communications Department' without 'Staishy.'
Fernanda is a standout who embodies the University value of excellence, and coaches me as a manager to help bring out excellence in my team.
Mark is the epitome of collaboration. He works incredibly hard to reach across units to share information and build great teams.

Andrew has demonstrated a wonderfully collegial nature, thoughtfully checking-in with colleagues, referring donors within his network to other environment units, and leaning-in on collaborative strategies. He brings a unique skillset to the team that has helped elevate our events, programming, and strategic decisions.

Courtney is a driven fundraiser who has pushed forward the fundraising capacity in the Neurosciences. She maximizes the resources available to her and creates strong, collaborative relationships with the faculty she works with.
The IT team really made it possible for the rest of Advancement to do our work remotely at the drop of a hat when the COVID-19 pandemic hit. Thank you all!

Be Boundless may be ending, but with Holly's great work we can rest assured that future fundraising campaigns and initiatives will thrive - thanks in part to her work identifying and spotlighting new high capacity donors for qualification and engagement.

Michael is a rising STAR and is helping to lead the way in developing our digital fundraising efforts from top to bottom. His efforts are vital to our ability to create meaningful fundraising campaigns, improved donor experiences, and increased philanthropic participation from the alumni and friends of UW.
We create impact. With Maya we create WONDERFUL and MEANINGFUL impact beyond what anyone expects.
An makes everyone around her better. She is a role model for utilizing the best practices for working with donors and colleagues alike.
The importance of her contributions to the CRM conversion project cannot be overstated.

Diane has continued to engage donors with enthusiasm and tackles challenges fearlessly. We are excited to see the impact of her work as she builds relationships internally and externally with those in the UW Botanic Gardens, Earth and Space Sciences, and School of Environmental and Forest Science departments.
In a few-years time, we will look back and see that Tara's work with our young alumni was a turning point for our school.
Alex is the ultimate teammate. He is truly a joy to work with and an irreplaceable asset to the APAA team and the advancement efforts of the university.

Taylor White is the ultimate purple and gold team player. She shares her knowledge, passion for the UW, collaborative nature, humor and awesome work ethic with us all. We, and the UWAA are better for it, and her.

Kearstin's insatiable curiosity to keep learning and exploring professional development raises the bar of the many ways she supports our team, not just doing the job needing to be done, but understanding how tasks are connected to a greater network of relationship building. She is a great asset to our team and will be a rising star in UW Advancement for many years to come.
Nick took the lead on Husky Giving day last year and produced incredible results not only for athletics but set a standard in good practice and strategies for all campus colleagues.

Remaining on campus and photographing everything from the Virology lab, to nurses working the front lines, to capturing the cherry blossoms for those who could not be on campus, Dennis has shown true dedication and an understanding that the Advancement mission matters.
Kaela starts and meets a global pandemic, current projects, and transition to a new role head on -- and rocks it!

unit: Evans School of Public Policy & Governance
quote: Brittany's dedication to her work and advancing the mission of the Evans School is exemplary. She approaches her work and accomplishes her goals with a curiosity, positivity, and commitment to excellence that make her a successful and very much appreciated member of our team.

Steph has made a lasting impression on the UW Alumni Tours program. Her ability to find new and better ways to streamline processes has saved valuable time while simultaneously improving the final product.
No one matches Namrata's ability to understand users' needs and build a data set that can run a report so accurately and quickly.
